result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Marcia L Buege in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Marcia L Buege.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy appears on behalf of ADA Brian J Pfeil for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Cassidy states the appearances.
 
Atty Maxwell Bergner puts a couple of issues on the record.
Atty Bergner states that he filed a request for substitution
Court questions if he wishes the substitution to continue.
Court will recuse herself from this case.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Defendant is informed to look for a notice and/or text with the new Judge.
Arraignment to be set with the new Judge assigned.
Defendant's Request for Substitution of Trial Judge filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner

4:10 PM Defendant Marcia L Buege in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Marcia L Buege.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

4:12 p.m.  Officer Lee is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Pfeil.
4:13 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
Record will reflect that the witness has identified the defendant.
4:16 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Bergner. 
ADA Pfeil has no redirect.
Witness is excused.
ADA Pfeil has an additional witness to call.
4:18 p.m.  Detective A Yenter is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Pfeil.
4:21 p.m  Cross examination by Atty Bergner.
ADA Pfeil has no redirect.
4:26 p.m.  Witness is excused.
ADA Pfeil has no additional witnesses or final argument.
Atty Bergner has no witnesses and no final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Bond is continued
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Matter set for a Prelim on 09/12/2022 at 3:00 p.m. - Officer was unavailable
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:06 PM . Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcia L Buege in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Marcia L Buege. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcia L Buege in court. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant states she does qualify for public defender but has not yet been appointed one. 
Court will continue this matter. 

State recommends a $ bond with conditions as stated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
